content:
Excellent choice on the coleslaw! It's a classic BBQ side dish that pairs perfectly with smoky grilled meats. The creamy texture and tangy flavor of coleslaw help cut through the richness of the chicken, and the crunch from the cabbage and carrots adds a nice textural element. I'm sure your sister's coleslaw was a great addition to the meal!

Your grilling technique sounds spot on! Using a combination of direct and indirect heat is a great way to achieve those perfect grill marks while ensuring the chicken is cooked through. The direct heat helps to sear the outside quickly, locking in the juices and creating those beautiful grill marks. Then, finishing the chicken off over indirect heat allows the heat to penetrate the meat more evenly, cooking it to a safe internal temperature without burning the outside.

It's great that you're experimenting with different grilling techniques and paying attention to the details. That's what separates a good BBQ from a great one! Did you use any specific type of grill or charcoal for this cookout, or was it a gas grill?

Also, have you thought about trying out any other BBQ recipes or techniques in the future? Perhaps something like smoking meats or trying out different types of wood for added flavor?
